alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 1:25PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EST... At 125 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Oldenburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Harrison, Batesville, Brookville, Ross, Oldenburg, Dunlap, Reily, New Haven, Sunman, St. Leon, Scipio, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Penntown, Interstate 74 at US Route 52, Rockdale, Sharptown, Saint Peter and Layhigh. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 150 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
